files.title: LinkedIn Convo
files.preview:
Caroline Williams  8:50 PM
Hi Jan,
 
I wanted to connect @John K. Ibare with you. John and I have had a mentor relationship for several years and tonight I sent him the link to Off Course so he could visualize it. He's working on some very interesting social impact learning for communities in his area (Kenya and Rwanda). 
Wishing you a great conversation!
files.preview_highlight:

Hi Jan,
 
I wanted to connect @John K. Ibare with you. John and I have had a mentor relationship for several years and tonight I sent him the link to Off Course so he could visualize it. He's working on some very interesting social impact learning for communities in his area (Kenya and Rwanda). 
Wishing you a great conversation!

attachments.title: Jeremiah Boehner on LinkedIn: ""Webinar leads for under $.70!!!! Woot !  Everyone here selling info products... if you have a webinar... listen. FB ads are amazing. BUT the costs are going up.  The best strategy in 2019 is getting cold traffic from INFLUENCERS.   Their traffic is warm! AND costs a FRACTION of the price.  Then go retarget them on Facebook ...  This is how you will win in 2019!"  I saw this in the Clickfunnels FB Group, the poster was trying to promote his own course, but he revealed a strategy that most people overlook when considering Influencer Marketing and lead generation.   You can use influencers to get in front of your target audience often for less than you can with a cold audience. When Russel Brunson launched Clickfunnels he targeted the top 100 internet marketer influencers people with huge mailing lists and created specific partnerships with each one to promote Clickfunnels and the various products he had.   You can use influencers to drive traffic to your landing page, content, offers, etc and use Facebook to retarget them.   You can do this the Russell way and find your dream 100 and partner or pay to play.   or  You can create several great pieces of content that you can pay influencers to distribute.   If you need help reach out.   #webinars #influencermarketing #Clickfunnels"
attachments.text: December 31, 2018: Jeremiah Boehner posted images on LinkedIn

text: <@U8AM0S37E> <@U0D6EPESC> <https://edtechamsterdam.nl> interesting? Jelka will be there as well

attachments.text:
EdTech Amsterdam is an informal meetup in the Amsterdam area for Startups, Scientists, Teachers and anyone interested in learning technology.Signup here to hear about the next Meetup or to RSVP.
INVITATION
Date              Jan 17th 2019  – 16:30 – 19:00.  Talks start at 17:00
Address       Kohnstammhuis, Wibautstraat 2-4, Amsterdam, room KSH 08A12
For the next EdTech Amsterdam on Jan. 17th we’ll be getting together for some exciting talks and some drinks at the Amsterdam University of Applies Sciences (known to many as the HvA) on the Wibautstraat. Thank you Faculty of Education for sponsoring!
Read on for the amazing lineup and please let us know you’re coming so we make sure there’s enough space.
Our theme for the day is “How EdTech ideas can turn into real world applications.” Several successful innovators will be showing us their work in short dazzling presentations sharing their road from idea to application.
Co-organizer Bert Bredeweg, lector at the HvA with an impressive history of research and innovation, is welcoming you and our speakers!
We’re really happy to have this amazing lineup!
Pim Bellinga, from Grasple, Youssef El Bouhassani from Leerlevels and the HvA, Annika Borgstede from Feeback Fruits, Wai Feersma Hoekstra from Digital Society school, Jaeques Koeman & Roland Groen from Edia.

Grasple – Speaker: Pim Bellinga
Grasple is a social enterprise with the mission to make knowledge as openly accessible as possible. To achieve that, we have developed an online editor- and practice platform that teachers in higher education use to find and edit open exercises (on math and statistics) and share them with students so they can practice with direct feedback. 
LeerLevels – Speaker: Youssef El Bouhassani
LeerLevels is an online learning platform for truly personalized learning. A combination of a curriculum built around fine-meshed learning objectives and artificial intelligence makes it possible to deliver exactly what a student needs at that moment. 
Feedbackfruits –  Speaker: Annika Borgstede
FeedbackFruits’ mission is to support teachers in facilitating learning activities that spark active thinking. With partnering universities in the EdTech consortium, FeedbackFruits facilitates the network and software to share and co-create new innovative learning activities together.  
Digital Society school –   Speaker: Wai Feersma Hoekstra
Digital Society School (DSS) is a modular knowledge and training institute with a design and development team that (a) organizes short trend-related modular programs (‘tracks’), (b) develops and implements digital solutions with the latest technology for students, teachers and researchers, and (c) helps to integrate the digital concepts developed by DSS into the business and society through training and executive programs. All activities of the DSS are linked to the Sustainable Development Goals of the UN. 
EDIA –  Speaker: Jaeques Koeman & Roland Groen
EDIA education technology was founded in 2004 and based in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. The founders of EDIA envisioned that smart automation would play a significant role in the content creation and publishing industry. In 2006, EDIA launched its first AI in education product, which used machine learning and natural language processing to curate online text sources for vocabulary training.

===
+ short description (one sentence)
+ how does it shares the pros of disquss and eleviates some of the cons. Now and in the future (opportunities)

Disquss
======
+ short description (one sentence) 
+ who in the consortium (vpro, waag, etc...) uses it
+ analysis pros/cons
